result.execSummary:
The defendant Deareal T. Lott was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery [Modifiers: Repeater], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).
  • Possess Firearm-Convicted of a Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Upon consideration of the information which has been submitted to the court on the issue of restitution:  Restitution is not ordered.

If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Counseling shall specifically include:  Anger management / DV counseling and  AODA Assessment and follow through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
May not have contact with Harborside Mobile, Kayla G, Stacy K, Earl S, Xavier W, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to Count 1 and Consecutive to 14CF743.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Deareal T. Lott

Defendant Deareal T. Lott appeared with Attorney Bradley J. Lochowicz.  Defendant in custody by Writ. Attorney Zachary L Brost appeared for the Prosecution.    Clerk JT  Minutes:  Hearing was scheduled for 10:15am but case was called at 11:08am.   Victim Mr. P was called by ADA Brost and stated he forgot about the hearing. DE Atty Lochowicz states he served the victim with a subpoena with the time of 10:15am for the hearing.   Victim has informed ADA Brost right before the hearing that he was more than 10 minutes away from Intake court but was driving.  Court finds the victim was duly served with notice of hearing.  Court finds restitution amount is $0 (zero).  State will prepare the Order.

That the stipulation of the parties is hereby adopted as the order of the court and
the defendants motion for post-conviction is hereby granted.
Submitted by Atty Bradley Lochowicz

ADA Birschbach and Attorney Lochowicz stipulate to the motion for post conviction relief and the case will be set for a restitution hearing.  Restitution hearing set for 12/5/18 @ 10:15 in Intake.  DA to prepare writ.

State of Wisconsin appears by ADA Andrew Burgoyne. DE appears in custody with Atty David Celebre.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  912 - Parties have rec'd and reviewed PSI. ADA Burgoyne files certified copy of JOC on 11CF221. Sentence recommendations.
  
Ct1:   Defendant is sentenced to 17.5 years in the WSP; 12.5 years Initial Confinement followed by 5 years of Extended Supervision consecutive to 14CF743.  DE (is ) eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program. 
Ct2:   Defendant is sentenced to 5 years in the WSP; 3 years Initial Confinement followed by 2 years of Extended Supervision consecutive to Ct1 and consecutive to 14CF743.  DE (is) eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program.  
Both counts:   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given. Court costs ordered. Restitution to be determined before Commissioner Dowse. No contact with Harborside Mobile, Xavier W., Kayla G., Marissa H., Earl S., Stacey K.  Voter rights, Firearms warning, Appeal rights given.
Opening Instructions
TF's Word
Ct 2: guilty
Ct 1: guilty
Jury questions 1-4
for Return/Destruction of Exhibits
Exhibits P1 through P6, D8, P10 through P18, D19 through D28 and D30 through 39 inventoried and stored in Br 1 exhibit room on 3/17/17 in a paper box. To be returned. vm

State of Wisconsin appears by ADA Andrew Burgoyne with KPD Det. K. Dumesic. DE appears in custody with Atty David Celebre.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  900 - Parties are prepared to proceed. Attorneys request individual voir dire with DE's expert witness prior to jury being brought in - granted. Atty Celebre further requests Court conduct colloquy with DE re: rights to testify - granted. DE sworn, and Court conducts colloquy. DE does not wish to testify on his own behalf. Dr. White sworn and advised as to subjects not permitted during testimony per stipulation. Parties stipulate to Dr. White's credentials. Jurors brought in at 9:11am.

DAY THREE:  Case resumes with continued testimony. Parties sworn and testified: MPPD Officer N. Willis, Dr. L. White. DE rests. ST calls rebuttal witness KPD Det. K. Dumesic. State's rebuttal rests. Exhibits 30-39 offered and rec'd by the Court. Exhibit 29 marked but not offered. Outside the presence of the jury and off the record, Court holds jury instruction conference. Jurors brought in at 1147. Exhibits 30-38 published for the jury. Court instructs jurors on principals of law. Closing arguments heard. Alternate juror #11 excused at 1:35pm. Bailiffs sworn. Jurors begin deliberations at 1:39pm. Court places stipulation as to juror questions 1, 2 on the record. Atty Celebre waives DE's appearance for purposes of answering juror questions. Jury reaches verdict at 3pm. Case recalled at 317. 
Verdict. Ct1: guilty, Ct2: guilty. Jury polled. Jurors released at 3:30pm. State moves for judgment on the verdict and for revocation of bond. DE takes no position. Judgment granted. DE found guilty by the Court on both counts. ***BOND REVOKED*** PSI ordered.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 26, 2017 at 09:00 am.
re: prior convictions

State of Wisconsin appears by ADA Andrew Burgoyne with KPD Det. K. Dumesic. DE appears in custody with Atty David Celebre.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  903 - ADA Burgoyne has reduced yesterday's stipulation as to criminal convictions to writing - filed this day. Jurors brought in at 907. 

DAY TWO:   Court reads stipulation reduced to writing by ADA Burgoyne to the jury on the record. Trial resumes with continuation of State's case. Witnesses sworn and testified: KPD Officer B. Ruha, KPD Det. K. Dumesic.  Jurors excused for lunch at 12:30 - to resume at 1:35. Case recalled at 1:42. Outside the presence of the jury, Atty Celebre makes motion for directed verdict. ST opposes motion. Court denies motion, and trial may continue. Atty Celebre requests colloquy be conducted re: prior convictions - granted. Witness Paula L. sworn and colloquy held. Court takes judicial notice of 10CM1999, 11CM529, 12CM254. Jurors called in at 2:25pm. State rests. Defense presents case. Witnesses sworn and testified: MPPD Officer N. Willis, KPD Det. J. Zeller, Rosetta L., Paula L., P&P Agent M. McConville. Exhibits 12-28 offered and rec'd by the Court. Exhibits 12-18, 25-28 published for the jury. Outside the presence of the jury, Court takes testimony from MPPD Officer N. Willis re: compliance with subpoena. Officer Willis is ordered to return on 3/16/17 @ 8:30am in possession of all photos of clothing and cell phones for additional testimony. Officer Willis is ordered to relay the Court's order to the Evidence Custodian for the Village of Mt. Pleasant to ensure the production of said photos. Jurors released at 4:30pm - to resume at 8:45am 3/16/17.  Jury trial scheduled for March 16, 2017 at 09:00 am.

State of Wisconsin appears by ADA Andrew Burgoyne with KPD Det. K. Dumesic. DE appears in custody with Atty David Celebre.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  932 - Court hears brief motions prior to commencement of trial. Atty Celebre has met with DE re: stipulation on prior conviction. DE sworn, and Court conducts colloquy. DE stipulates to prior conviction - accepted by the Court. Court takes testimony re: identification of DE. Parties sworn and testified: KPD Det. G. Munnelly, KPD Officer A. Hancock, KPD Officer B. Ruha. Civilian witnesses Kayla G. and Earl S. sworn and testify re: criminal convictions. Jury brought in @ 952.

DAY ONE: Impaneled jury sworn and pre-instructed. Opening statements. State presents case. Parties sworn and testified: Kayla G., Marissa H., KPD Sgt. D. Nichols. Court releases jurors for lunch at 12:04. Case recalled at 133. Testimony resumes. Parties sworn and testified: KPD Officer J. Krein, KPD Det. G. Munnelly. Jurors removed to allow Court to conduct colloquy with witness. Witness Xavier W. sworn and testified re: prior convictions. Jurors return at 2:13. Testimony resumes. Parties sworn and testified: Xavier W., Stacey K., KPD Officer A. Hancock, KPD Officer A. Barriere, KPD Sgt. D. Bandi  Exhibits 1-6, 8, 10, 11 offered and rec'd by the Court. Exhibits 7 & 9 withdrawn. Court takes judicial notice of Exhibit 6. Court adjourns for the day and releases jurors at 4:35. Trial to resume at 8:45 on 3/15.  Jury trial scheduled for March 15, 2017 at 09:00 am.

State of Wisconsin appears by ADA Andrew Burgoyne with KPD Det. Keith Dumesic. DE appears in custody with Atty David Celebre.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  921 - Parties prepared to proceed to trial. ST moves that witnesses sequestered from all portions of trial, including voir dire. Jury sworn-in and pre-instructed on priciples of law. Voir dire commences at 0945. Voir dire concludes at 1103. Jury of 13 impaneled - to be sworn upon return tomorrow at 8:45. Jurors released at 1115. Court hears motions. Atty Celebre moves for individual questioning outside the presence of the jury of 3 specific witnesses re: identification for the purposes of Motion to Suppress. Granted - questioning to be held upon return of all parties on 3/14. Court holds Miranda Goodchild hearing. Parties sworn and testified: KPD Det. K. Dumesic. For reasons set forth on the record, Court finds statements were voluntary and made in accordance with Miranda rights. Statements shall be allowed. Court hears Motions in Limine. Stipulations/objections on State's motions placed on the record. Stipulations/objections on DE's motions placed on the record. Jury trial to commence 3/14 @ 9am.
Jury Selection and Peremptory Challenges
NO RECORD MADE. Matter prepared to proceed to trial as set.

State of Wisconsin appears by ADA Andrew Burgoyne. DE appears by Atty David Celebre. DE's appearance waived - not writted for JSH.   Clerk P. Scypta.

State of Wisconsin appears by ADA Andrew Burgoyne. DE appears in custody with Atty David Celebre.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES: 247 - Motions for Discovery and Suppression of search and i.d. have been filed. Atty Celebre withdraws motion to suppress warrantless search - no objection by ST. So Ordered. After meeting with ADA Burgoyne, parties now agree that the ST may go forward with testimony re: i.d. from KPD Officers Ruha and Hancock. KPD Det. Munnely to be questioned at voir dire before trial. The remaining officers named in the initial list of officers testifying to i.d. are no longer intended to be used at trial to that effect. This resolved motion for suppression of i.d. Motion for Discovery discussed. Copies of booking photos used in i.d. provided by KPD Det. Dumesic provided to Atty Celebre in court - Atty Celebre acknowledges receipt. No report on Atty Celebre's Notice of Alibi has been rec'd from KPD Det. Zeller to date. ADA Burgoyne indicates no report was written, nor were statements taken from witnesses. Court orders that should any notes/reports exist on this matter and have not already been turned over to DE, they are to be provided to the DE timely. Atty Celebre reports DE now wishes to waive a jury trial and have a trial to the Court. The Court will conduct no colloquy today - will possibly conduct colloquy after jury status hearing. DE stipulates to all issues addressed in this hearing.
